API Docs

quantcerebro

QuantCerebro is a Python package the provides configurable framework to describe relationships among business logics. The common relationship among business logic can be a. event; b. callable (interface).

See docs for complete documentation.

builder

Builder for Scenario: NodeSet, Node and Scenario Config: NodeSetConfig, NodeConfig.

There are two classes implemented: ConfigBuilder and ScenarioBuilder

Scenario Configuration:

Scenario Configuration is specified in yaml format, and takes the below construct.

---
name: ...
nodesetClass: ...
nodesetConfigClass: ...
components:
    - name: ...
      nodeClass: ...
    - name: ...
      nodesetClass: ...
edges:
    - pred: ...
      succ: ...
      edgeType: ...
      edgeClass: ...
componentConfigs:
    - name: ...
      configClass: ...
      ...
    - name: ...
      nodesetPath: ...

Configuration File keywords:

  • name: scenario name,

    Note

    when a nodeset is a sub-scenario, the component.name defined in parent scenario will overwrite this name.

  • nodesetClass: scenario class path, by default, you may specify as quantcerebro.nodeset.NodeSet

    Note

    when a nodeset is a sub-scenario, the component.nodesetClass defined in parent scenario will overwrite this field.

  • nodesetConfigClass: scenario config class path, by default, you may specify as quantcerebro.nodeset.NodeSetConfig

  • components: component section, component can be a type Node, or type NodeSet

    • components.name: component name

      Note

      • this field is required to be unique in a scenario configuration setup.

      • this field will overwrite name of a sub-scenario, as subscenario is identified by componentConfigs.nodesetpath

    • components.nodeClass: node as a component, and this field specifies the class of the node

    • components.nodesetClass: nodeset as a component, and this field specifies the class of the nodeset

      Note

      this field will overwrite nodesetClass of a sub-scenario, where sub-scenario is identified by componentConfigs.nodesetpath

  • edges: dependency section, which specifies dependencies among components

    • edges.pred: predecessor component name

      Note

      • when component is a node, this is the node name

      • when component is a nodeset, this is [nodeset name].[node name], though only the last [node name] matters.

    • edges.succ: successor component name, same as edges.succ

    • edges.edgeType: dependency type: callable or event

    • edges.edgeClass: data class that handles the dependency data from pred to succ.

  • componentConfigs: config section for component configs that used to initialise component a component

    • componentConfigs.name: component name as reference, there must be a one-to-one mapping with component section.

    • componentConfigs.[...]: other user defined attributes when component is a node

    • componentConfigs.nodesetPath: nodeset’s path when component is a pre-defined nodeset

class quantcerebro.builder.ScenarioBuilder(nodeset_config)[source]

Builds a composite scenario from composite config.

__init__(nodeset_config)[source]
Parameters

nodeset_config (NodeSetConfig) – composite scenario config

build_components()[source]

instantiate child component level by level from the top. Stack keeps track of a nodeset by name and it’s child configs, while stack is not empty, add each element from stack to it’s parent nodeset. After components are instantiated, consolidate all implemented interfaces and implemented handlers. These two functions puts implemented interface (event handlers) into a dictionary, so it can be referenced.

Note

component name should be unique in a scenario

Return type

NodeSet

Returns

the scenario with all child component instantiated, but no dependencies are registered.

add_component(component, switch_to=True)[source]

add a scenario component to current nodeset level, when switch_to is true and current component is a nodeset, switch to this nodeset branch :type component: ScenarioComponent :param component: scenario component :type switch_to: bool :param switch_to: whether to switch to the added nodeset or not

build_edges()[source]

register configured dependnecies level by level. Stack keeps track of a nodeset by name and it’s child configs, edge_stack keep tracks a nodeset, and it’s child config dependencies. After edge_stack is fully populated, iterate through and register dependencies one by one :rtype: NodeSet :return: the scenario with all dependencies built

add_edge(edge)[source]

add a dependency to a nodeset

set_current_nodeset(nodeset)[source]

set current nodeset pointer to the input

static init_component_with_config(config)[source]

takes in a config of scenario component, and build it :type config: Config :param config: either type NodeConfig or type NodeSetConfig :rtype: ScenarioComponent :return: child component of scenario

name_check(name)[source]

check if name is already used

Return type

None

class quantcerebro.builder.ConfigBuilder(file_path)[source]

ConfigBuilder takes in a yaml file, and returns a composite configuration NodeSetConfig

Parameters

file_path (str) – configuration file location

__init__(file_path)[source]
build()[source]
Return type

NodeSetConfig

Returns

NodeSetConfig

process_dict(config_dict)[source]

the instantiated dictionary from yaml file is not in composite format, so this preprocessing step assembles it into a correct format :type config_dict: Dict[str, Any] :param config_dict: the raw format of yaml dictionary :return: returns a composite patterned dictionary

meta

This section implements the meta classes for quantcerebro components. It defines the skeleton of attributes and functionality a class component should implement.

class quantcerebro.meta.ScenarioComponent[source]

Scenario Component has two child implementation. Node and NodeSet Scenario Component is an abstract class that inherents from PredecessorTemplate and SuccessorTemplate

class quantcerebro.meta.Config(name, config_class)[source]

Base class for Scenario Component Configurations, there are two child implementations, NodeSetConfig and NodeConfig. :type name: str :param name: name of the config :type config_class: str :param config_class: the string path to designinated Config Class :param parent: not a required param, by default it’s None, and set at runtime by scenario config

event

class quantcerebro.event.GraphEvent(name='', _with_error_done_events=True)[source]

Event Between Nodes on a graph level

__init__(name='', _with_error_done_events=True)[source]
error_event

Sub event that emits errors from this event as emit(source, exception).

done_event

Sub event that emits when this event is done as emit(source).

class quantcerebro.event.GraphEventEmitter(*args, **kwargs)[source]

A very basic realisation of NodeJS’s event emitter to keep track of GraphEvents
